programs.name: Startup SG Founder
programs.description: Provides mentorship and startup capital grant of S$50,000 to first-time entrepreneurs with innovative business ideas. Startups are required to commit S$10,000 as co-matching fund to the grant.

programs.name: Startup SG Tech
programs.description: Supports Proof-of-Concept (POC) and Proof-of-Value (POV) for commercialisation of innovative technologies.

programs.name: Adopt Technology to Digitise My Business
Operation & Technology Roadmap (OTR)
programs.description: Development of technology roadmaps to map out priorities aligned with businesses’ strategies and developmental plans. Eligible SMEs may receive up to 70% funding support.

programs.name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
programs.description: Supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.

programs.name: Start Digital
programs.description: SMEs new to using digital technology can adopt any 2 solutions e.g. Digital Marketing, Digital Collaboration, Accounting, HR/Payroll, Cybersecurity, etc., at no cost for at least 6 months (min. 18 months contract).

programs.name: Technology for Enterprise Capability Upgrading (T-Up)
programs.description: Get access to talents from A*STAR’s Research Institutes and build in-house R&D capabilities.

programs.name: Career Trial
programs.description: Allows companies to assess jobseekers’ job fit through a short-term trial, before formal employment. Government will provide training allowance to the jobseekers for the trial period (up to 3 months).

programs.name: Jobs Growth Incentive (JGI)
programs.description: The Jobs Growth Incentive (JGI) was announced on 17 Aug 2020 to encourage employers to accelerate their hiring of local workforce by providing wage support, so as to create good and long-term jobs for locals.

programs.name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
programs.description: The PSG supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.

programs.name: Senior Employment Credit
programs.description: No application is required. The Senior Employment Credit provides wage offsets to help employers that employ workers aged 55 and above adjust to the higher Retirement Age and Re-employment Age.

programs.name: SkillsFuture Work-Study Programmes (WSPs)
programs.description: Businesses can groom and hire fresh talent through Work-Study Programmes across Certificate, Diploma, Post-Diploma, and Degree levels. Businesses will jointly design and deliver with Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs) and appointed private providers.

programs.name: Start Digital
programs.description: SMEs new to using digital technology can adopt any 2 solutions e.g. Digital Marketing, Digital Collaboration, Accounting, HR/Payroll, Cybersecurity, etc., at no cost for at least 6 months (min. 18 months contract).

programs.name: Wage Credit Scheme
programs.description: No application is required. The government provides co-funding of wage increments for Singaporean employees earning a gross monthly wage of up to $5,000.

programs.name: e-Adviser for Skills Training
programs.description: For business owners to get personalised recommendations on skills training courses and SkillsFuture initiatives relevant to your business as part of the SkillsFuture Movement.

programs.name: SkillsFuture for Enterprise User Guide
programs.description: Check out the 5 key steps to get started on your SkillsFuture journey

programs.name: Career Trial
programs.description: Allows companies to assess jobseekers’ job fit through a short-term trial, before formal employment. Government will provide training allowance to the jobseekers for the trial period (up to 3 months).

programs.name: Citrep+
programs.description: Build ICT technical skills for your employees in areas such as cyber security, data analytics, network and infrastructure and software development. Funding support of up to 90%.

programs.name: Company-Led Training (CLT) Programme
programs.description: CLT accelerates professional development through on-the-job training programme for fresh to mid-level professionals acquiring competencies for jobs in demand by industry, especially the Digital Economy sector.

programs.name: Employment Support for Ex-Offenders
programs.description: This programme supports companies to tap on ex-offenders as an alternative pool of trained and skilled workers.

programs.name: Employment Support for Persons with Disabilities
programs.description: Hire, train and integrate Persons with Disabilities into the workforce. Receive course fee subsidies of up to 90% for SG Enable’s list of curated training courses.

programs.name: Enabling Employment Credit
programs.description: The Enabling Employment Credit provides wage offsets to employers hiring persons with disabilities.

programs.name: Enhanced Training Support for SMEs (ETSS)
programs.description: The ETSS offers higher course fee grant of up to 90% of the course fees and absentee payroll funding of 80% of basic hourly salary at a higher cap of $7.50 per hour for SMEs signing up for SSG-supported courses. With effect from 1 Jan 2022, SSG will introduce a fixed absentee payroll rate of $4.50 per hour, capped at $100,000 per organisation annually.

programs.name: Jobs Growth Incentive (JGI)
programs.description: The Jobs Growth Incentive (JGI) was announced on 17 Aug 2020 to encourage employers to accelerate their hiring of local workforce by providing wage support, so as to create good and long-term jobs for locals.

programs.name: Part-Time Re-employment Grant (PTRG)
programs.description: Provides funding support to companies that voluntarily commit to providing part-time re-employment to all eligible seniors who request for it.

programs.name: SkillsFuture Work-Study Programmes (WSPs)
programs.description: Businesses can groom and hire fresh talent through Work-Study Programmes across Certificate, Diploma, Post-Diploma, and Degree levels. Businesses will jointly design and deliver with Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs) and appointed private providers.

programs.name: Uplifting Employment Credit
programs.description: The Uplifting Employment Credit provides wage offsets to employers hiring ex-offenders.

programs.name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
programs.description: Supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.

programs.name: Progressive Wage Credit Scheme
programs.description: Provides transitional support to employers for Progressive Wages moves, by co-funding wage increases of lower-wage workers between 2022 and 2026.

programs.name: Startup SG Founder
programs.description: Provides mentorship and startup capital grant of S$50,000 to first-time entrepreneurs with innovative business ideas. Startups are required to commit S$10,000 as co-matching fund to the grant.

programs.name: 3R Fund
programs.description: Supports companies and organisations registered in Singapore to implement waste minimisation and recycling projects to reduce solid waste sent for disposal.

programs.name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
programs.description: Supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.

programs.name: Water Efficiency Fund (WEF)
programs.description: Provides funding to local non-domestic water users to enable them to improve water efficiency through water efficiency assessment, pilot study, recycling, adoption of water efficient equipment & industrial water solution demonstration projects.

programs.name: Part-Time Re-employment Grant (PTRG)
programs.description: Provides funding support to companies that voluntarily commit to providing part-time re-employment to all eligible seniors who request for it.

programs.name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
programs.description: Supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.
